author: jochembrouwer
content: I have found this page at some point but cannot seem to find it again. Is there a page somewhere which explicitly defines what `P` and `B_32` is? (e.g. in https://github.com/ethereum/devp2p/blob/master/caps/snap.md#getaccountrange-0x00 -> `[reqID: P, rootHash: B_32, startingHash: B_32, limitHash: B_32, responseBytes: P]`)

author: g11tech
content: also a related question to this, if rootHash for e.g. has leading `00` bytes, like 0x000001222..., then can it be send like '0x01222'...? if its a full 32 bytes long, wouldn't it be better to strip off those zeros and save data bandwidth?

author: holiman
content: I'm sure there is, but I don't have a link. However, a B_32 is fixed-size 32 byte, so a hash. Whereas P is arbitrary size byte array

author: holiman
content: Why would a roothash ever have any significant number of leading zeros?

author: holiman
content:
One network optimization to be aware ofz though, is 

> accBody: Account body in slim format

author: holiman
content: I.e: not in trie consensus format

author: g11tech
content: yea roothash is a bad example, account hashes (for e.g. in AccountRange/GetStorageRanges etc could have leading 00ss for syncing on range)

author: g11tech
content: but yes mostly unlikely there as well, as highly probable hash of something not having leading zeros

author: g11tech
content: so the real data would most likely not have it i guess

author: holiman
content: Also, let's not forget that the whole thing is snappy compressed too, so inefficiencies like repeated patterns are somewhat made moot by that

author: g11tech
content: ohh yes, that would compress it away! thanks <@211091239112671234> üôè  for this

author: holiman
content:
Syncing a OVH-cloud dedicated machine now, from scratch. 
** Account/slot + blocks **
```
Sep 05 16:36:54 orangina geth INFO [09-05|14:36:54.938] State sync in progress synced=0.46% state=928.60MiB accounts=987,692@197.46MiB slots=3,460,491@700.24MiB codes=9783@30.90MiB eta=-384.452ms
...
Sep 05 18:49:50 orangina geth INFO [09-05|16:49:50.639] State sync in progress synced=43.51% state=84.41GiB accounts=80,070,378@18.18GiB slots=320,709,853@64.37GiB codes=320,861@1.85GiB eta=2h52m35.845s
Sep 05 18:50:06 orangina geth INFO [09-05|16:50:06.364] Imported new block receipts              count=104  elapsed=249.467ms number=10,008,538 hash=4c2276..3d295e age=2y4mo1w   size=2.10MiB
...
Sep 05 21:54:56 orangina geth INFO [09-05|19:54:56.489] State sync in progress synced=79.83% state=155.63GiB accounts=147,158,882@33.36GiB slots=595,514,278@119.02GiB codes=542,235@3.24GiB eta=1h19m40.984s
...
Sep 06 00:47:10 orangina geth INFO [09-05|22:47:10.797] State sync in progress synced=100.00% state=198.65GiB accounts=184,202,366@41.79GiB slots=765,616,475@152.87GiB codes=658,358@3.99GiB eta=-3m14.052s
```
So it started at `16:34`and at `18:50` it had downloaded 10M blocks(+bodies), `84GiB` state, at an estimated `43%`. It's own estimate is that it will finish that phase roughly five hours after it started. 
It completed the account/slot parts at `00:47`, so in roughly `8h:13m`.
